subclusters.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
DNA Damage and Telomere Dysfunction-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
Immune Cell Senescence and Immunosenescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on permanent proliferative arrest and SASP driving chronic inflammation and tissue dysfunction, a core theme shared with many theories emphasizing SASP's role in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence induced by DNA damage and radiation, highlighting SASP-driven tissue dysfunction and chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP's role in lung fibrosis and chronic inflammation, illustrating antagonistic pleiotropy of senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details dual roles of senescence and SASP in tumor suppression, wound healing, and chronic inflammation driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links NF-κB regulation of SASP to inflammaging and mitochondrial ROS-induced telomere dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on kidney senescence with SASP driving inflammation, fibrosis, and age-related organ dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells’ dual roles and SASP-driven chronic inflammation contributing to aging and diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescence induced by multiple stressors and SASP’s role in systemic aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on molecular pathways of senescence, SASP secretion, and tumor suppression-aging trade-offs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes musculoskeletal aging driven by senescent cells and SASP, and therapeutic modulation by exercise and senolytics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links senescence and SASP to metabolic diseases like diabetes and osteoporosis, emphasizing chronic sterile inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cells in bone aging, SASP-driven inflammation, and senolytic therapies for skeletal pathologies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details cardiovascular aging driven by senescent cells and SASP, with senolytics as therapeutic agents.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, and experimental clearance supporting causal role in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Telomere Dysfunction-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage response, telomere dysfunction, oxidative stress, and epigenetic regulation as triggers and modulators of senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Telomere Dysfunction-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative stress-induced DNA damage, telomere shortening, and defective inflammation resolution in lung aging and COPD.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Telomere Dysfunction-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes in vivo senescence with p16INK4a marker accumulation independent of telomere shortening, emphasizing DNA damage and stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Telomere Dysfunction-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence induction by stress, tumor suppressor regulation (p53, Rb), and stem cell function limitation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Telomere Dysfunction-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as a programmed state with metabolic and epigenomic remodeling driven by DNA damage and telomere attrition.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Cell Senescence and Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of senescent immune and stromal cells in secondary lymphoid organs, immune dysfunction, and microbiota influence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Cell Senescence and Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes loss of immune cell identity, increased heterogeneity, and inflammatory signaling contributing to immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Cell Senescence and Immunosenescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights metabolic reprogramming of senescent cells affecting immune function and promoting immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cell Death and Senescence Interaction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses balance between apoptosis and senescence as parallel protective mechanisms influencing tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cellular Senescence and Reprogramming Barrier Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence impairing induced pluripotent stem cell reprogramming and links between aging pathways and cellular plasticity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Regulation of Stem Cell Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes metabolic plasticity, metabolism-epigenetic axis, and dysregulated metabolic pathways driving stem cell senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: RNA Sensing-Mediated Endothelial Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes self-RNA accumulation activating RIG-I sensor, inducing interferon-like response and SASP in endothelial senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sphingolipid-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on sphingolipid balance (ceramide and S1P) regulating senescence induction and SASP-driven inflammation in aging.
